title: Making is Greater Than Blessing
subtitle: An Exhortation on Biblical Giving
speaker: Unknown

source.full_service_title: Online Campus | Harvest Intercontinental Church-Olney | LIVE Broadcast

scripture_references.context: Warning against teaching godliness as a means of gain
Principles of generous giving and blessing
The church of Laodicea - rich but spiritually poor

key_themes: God's priority: making us like Christ over blessing us
Dangers of giving for personal gain
key_points: God's primary goal is to make us into the image of His Son, not merely to bless us
We should not give to gain blessings or out of need, but to become like Christ
The church in the West faces the Laodicean danger of self-sufficiency
Jesus gave knowing many would not respond - we are called to the same sacrificial generosity
Giving detaches our hearts from material things and attaches us to the Lord
summary: This exhortation challenges believers to understand that God's purpose in calling us to give is not primarily about receiving blessings, but about transforming us into the image of Christ. The speaker addresses two extremes: giving to get blessed, and not giving because we feel we already have enough. True biblical giving reflects Christ's sacrificial love and transforms the giver's character.
